Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2008 08:27PM SammieKay wrote: Mary, My granddaughter knitted me a nightcap.  It was very cozy.  Do you knit or know someone who knits?  The wig caps always hurt my head.  I had a wig before breast cancer and wore the cap to hold my hair in place under the wig.  I am 16 months post chemo with a head full of hair.  Mine came back curly and thicker than before.  Good luck girls.  The hair does come back.  My eyelashes came back first.  I started Taxol in Feb.07 and my hair came out 3 weeks into the 12 weekly doses of Taxol.  Then I had FAC and that really finished it off.  It was cold and my head was cold.  I wore wigs during the day, but at night needed a night cap, no pun intended.  Sammie Kay

Posts.Content: Jun 2, 2009 05:13PM SammieKay wrote: Wow Ellen,  Sometimes I understand very well what my  onc at MD Anderson told me early on.....he doesn't do any scans or blood work routinely because he says it causes much unnecessary anxiety.  He said that most of the abnormalities that show up are nothing and if I have a recurrence I am considered incurable.  Now, he didn't mean there was no hope..  I have a sister-in-law who is 10 years post recurrence, doing well on an aromatase inhibitor.  Remember most of the things we fear never materialize.  My onc said to me...."go, live:.  That is what I am doing.  My Mom used to say, "Worry is the interest we pay on the trouble we borrow". I feel for you and your anxiety.  I don't have a lot if experience to offer about scans or lab work.  I am just moving on and living life to the fullest. We are exactly 2 years apart on our diagnosis. I had bil mx and chemo.  I didn't have radiation, my choice.  I had clear nodes and not CA in the breast tissue they removed. I will check back to see how things turn out.  I am on a thread called Anyone starting chem in Feb.  We don't have a year, but it was 2007 and we call ourselves the Feb.ChemoCruisers.  Several of us still keep in touch.  We have lost one and two others have had a recurrence.  Some just don't want to continue as it is too depressing to face.  But I consider the love and support we give each other, regardless of the outcome worthwhile.  Friends forever through the good times and the bad ones. Keep the faith girl.  Hugs, Sammie Kay

Posts.Content: Feb 11, 2008 04:30PM - edited Feb 11, 2008 04:31PM by SammieKay Hi Feb '08 group, I am Sammie Kay from the Feb.07 group. I always preface any comment I make with "everyone is different". My chemo was 5Fu,cytoxen, and adriamycin(red devil).  I was there about 3 hours each time.  You certainly could crochet or knit if you have a port.  Might interfere if you have an IV in your arm.  I didn't get a reaction until about 3 hours after chemo. The steroids made me antsy and I had trouble sleeping for a few days.  The nausea medicine helped some, to make me sleepy.  I took Zofran for nausea and ask for some Phenergan because it has a drowsiness side effect. Glad to hear you girls have your '08 group going.  It is such a comfort to be going through this together.  A real bonding experience. Hugs to everyone, Sammie Kay
